---
  description: Shows continuous colour scales mapped onto values and then convert them with ggplotly.
  function: guide_colourbar
  permalink: /ggplot2/Guides axes and legends/guide_colourbar/
  layout: base
  language: ggplot2
  name: guide_colourbar
  reference: https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/
---



# Default colourbar bins

Using scales.

<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-  p1 + scale_fill_continuous(guide = "colourbar")

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

    compare="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plotly/ssim_baselines/main/out_ggplot2/ggplot2/Guides%20axes%20and%20legends/guide_colourbar/example1_montage.png"

You can also use `guide_colourbar()` inside scales. 

<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-  p1 + scale_fill_continuous(guide = guide_colourbar())

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Using guides 

You can also achieve the same result using `guides()` and `fill`.

<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-  p1 + guides(fill = guide_colourbar())

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Style - size

<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-  p1 + guides(fill = guide_colourbar(barwidth = 0.5, barheight = 10))

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Style - remove labels


<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-  p1 + guides(fill = guide_colourbar(label = FALSE))

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Style - remove ticks



<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-  p1 + guides(fill = guide_colourbar(ticks = FALSE))

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-  p1 + guides(fill = guide_colourbar(label.position = "left"))

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Style - label theme

<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-  p1 + guides(fill = guide_colourbar(label.theme = element_text(colour = "blue", angle = 0)))

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-  p1 + guides(fill = guide_colourbar(nbin = 3))

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Make top/bottom-most ticks invisible


<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-    
 p1 +
  scale_fill_continuous(
    limits = c(0,20), breaks = c(0, 5, 10, 15, 20),
    guide = guide_colourbar(nbin = 100, draw.ulim = FALSE, draw.llim = FALSE)
   )
   
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

# Independently control guides

Using `guide` argument in scale.

<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-    
 p2 +
  scale_fill_continuous(guide = "colourbar") +
  scale_size(guide = "legend")
  
plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

Using `guides()`


<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-  p2 + guides(fill = "colourbar", size = "legend")

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>

Independent control:



<pre class="mcode">
df <- expand.grid(X1 = 1:10, X2 = 1:10)
df$value <- df$X1 * df$X2

p1 <- ggplot(df, aes(X1, X2)) + geom_tile(aes(fill = value))
p2 <- p1 + geom_point(aes(size = value))

p <-    
 p2 +
  scale_fill_continuous(guide = guide_colourbar(direction = "horizontal")) +
  scale_size(guide = guide_legend(direction = "vertical"))

plotly::ggplotly(p)
</pre>
